etymologies: Old English, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch gist and German Gischt ‘froth, yeast’, from an Indo-European root shared by Greek zein ‘to boil’

definitions: a microscopic fungus consisting of single oval cells that reproduce by budding, and are capable of converting sugar into alcohol and carbon dioxide.
shortDefinitions: microscopic fungus consisting of single oval cells that reproduce by budding

definitions: a grayish-yellow preparation of yeast obtained chiefly from fermented beer, used as a fermenting agent, to raise bread dough, and as a food supplement.
shortDefinitions: greyish-yellow preparation of yeast fungus obtained chiefly from fermented beer, used as fermenting agent, to raise bread dough

definitions: any unicellular fungus that reproduces vegetatively by budding or fission, including forms such as candida that can cause disease.
shortDefinitions: any unicellular fungus that reproduces vegetatively by budding or fission
